definition: to enjoy the present (idiom); to live happily with no thought for the future/make merry while you can/carpe diem
and/to reach/up to/in time for
o'clock/time/when/hour/season/period
surname Shi
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense
happy/cheerful/to laugh
music
surname Le
surname Yue

sentences.english: If you love life, think carpe diem.
sentences.chinese: 假如你熱愛生命，就想想及時行樂這句話。

sentences.english: Carpe diem is an empowering idea.
sentences.chinese: 及時行樂是個使人充滿活力的想法。

sentences.english: Let me tell you about carpe diem .
sentences.chinese: 讓我來告訴你及時行樂的重要。

sentences.english: Fourth, carpe diem means don't waste time.
sentences.chinese: 第四，及時行樂意謂著不浪費時間。

sentences.english: Young people like to enjoy- life and they often burn the candle at both ends.
sentences.chinese: 年輕人喜歡及時行樂，他們往往濫耗精力。

sentences.english: Ten thousand years is too long, seize the time, seize the day!
sentences.chinese: 阿力哥，這句是說一萬年太久，須及時行樂？

sentences.english: Keep that in mind and rejoice.
sentences.chinese: 把這緊記在心及時行樂吧。

sentences.english: Foreigners mostly live for today attitude is much more prevalent than their Chinese counterparts.
sentences.chinese: 大多數外國人奉行及時行樂的態度。

sentences.english: Second, carpe diem means time is a precious gift.
sentences.chinese: 第二，及時行樂意謂著時間是一份很珍貴的禮物。

sentences.english: His attitude towards his life is carpe diem.
sentences.chinese: 他對生活的態度是及時行樂。

sentences.english: Let me tel you about carpe diem.
sentences.chinese: 讓我來告訴你及時行樂的重要。

sentences.english: Carpe diem. Seize the day, boys. Make your lives extraordinary.
sentences.chinese: 及時行樂，把握今天，夥計們，讓你的生活更非凡。

sentences.english: I believe the first step toward being happy and enjoying your environment is living in the moment.
sentences.chinese: 我認爲變得快樂和享受生活的第一步就是及時行樂。

sentences.english: It provides the energy for feelings that demand the immediate satisfaction of needs and desires.
sentences.chinese: 它提供感受對及時行樂需求的能量。

definition: to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
to waste time on worthless activities
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to feel disheartened
unlucky
the hypocrisy of the world (idiom)
to have no cares/to be carefree
at home wherever one is (idiom); ready to adapt/flexible/to accept circumstances with good will
to look forward and back/to consider prudently/overcautious
to be a tax on (one's mind)/to bother/to trouble/to be concerned
to whine/to be grouchy
lit. firewood, rice, oil, salt, soy, vinegar, and tea/fig. life's daily necessities
pinyin: chai2 mi3 you2 yan2 jiang4 cu4 cha2

definition: mountain and river exhausted (idiom); at the end of the line/nowhere to go
better to have nothing (than substandard choice) (idiom); would prefer to go without than accept shoddy option
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
to find joy in sorrows (idiom); to enjoy sth in spite of one's suffering
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
